newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK's financial secretary defends GDP revision.
newsitem.headline: HK's financial secretary defends GDP revision.

text.p: Hong Kong Financial Secretary Donald Tsang has defended his latest 4.7 percent 1996 economic growth forecast for the British-ruled territory against suggestions that it was over-optimistic.

"Whoever said this, whoever said we have not being doing a correct job, I think they have to come up with evidence. It is not a question of guessing," Tsang told reporters at Hong Kong's airport after returning from New Zealand late on Saturday.
The forecast issued by the government on Friday was a downward revision from its previous figure of 5.0 percent gross domestic product (GDP) growth contained in Tsang's budget in March.
Some analysts said the revision was insufficient and that even 4.7 percent would be tough to achieve.
But Tsang said the revision was based on facts and data. "I expect the rest of the year to be better than the first half," he said.
Trade figures would improve, he said, as had jobs and price data in recent months. "All the indications are that better months are ahead," he added.
